vn.com.uiza.views.overscroll.lib.overscroll

Interface IOverScrollDecor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HorizontalOverScrollBounceEffectDecorator, OverScrollBounceEffectDecoratorBase, VerticalOverScrollBounceEffectDecorator

      • getCurrentState

        int getCurrentState()
        Get the current decorator's runtime state, i.e. one of the values specified by IOverScrollState.
        Returns:
        The state.

      • detach

        void detach()
        Detach the decorator from its associated view, thus disabling it entirely.

        It is best to call this only when over-scroll isn't currently in-effect - i.e. verify that getCurrentState()==IOverScrollState.STATE_IDLE as a precondition, or otherwise use a state listener previously installed using setOverScrollStateListener(IOverScrollStateListener).

        Note: Upon detachment completion, the view in question will return to the default Android over-scroll configuration (i.e. View.OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS mode). This can be overridden by calling View.setOverScrollMode(mode) immediately thereafter.
